alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 7:56AM CST until February 28 at 6:13PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flood waters cover the soccer fields and bottomland along the river. Hickman Springs Road, Defeated Creek Road, and Leatherwood Road will be impassable. Defeated Creek will flood due to backwater from the Duck River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 23.7 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CST Monday was 28.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by this evening, and below action stage by Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.7 feet on 04/05/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM CST.
